required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Pediatric Patients With Spinal Muscular Atrophy in China: A Nationwide Registry

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of the study is to describe the natural history and utilization of disease modifying therapy (DMT) treatments among pediatric chinese participants with spinal muscular atrophy linked to chromosome 5q (5q-SMA).

primary_outcome.measure: Natural History and Utilization of Disease Modifying Therapy (DMT) Treatments Among Pediatric Chinese Participants With Spinal Muscular Atrophy Linked to Chromosome 5q (5q-SMA)

other_outcome.description: Effectiveness will be assessed using following measures: time to mortality, motor function, motor measures, pulmonary function, scoliosis, hospitalizations and comorbidities, clinical observations, patient reported outcomes, wheelchair use, nutrition and electrophysiology and biomarkers.
Safety will be assessed by adverse events (AEs) and serious AEs.

arm_group.description: Participants with SMA who received prior treatment with DMTs including nusinersen will be followed prospectively for up to 21 months and the available data is collected retrospectively.
Participants with SMA who received no treatment will be followed prospectively for up to 21 months.

study_pop.textblock: Pediatric participants with 5q-SMA will be enrolled to obtain information on both the natural history of the disease and effectiveness and safety of DMTs.

criteria.textblock:
Key Inclusion Criteria:
- Ability of the participant and/or his/her legally authorized representative (e.g., parent or legal guardian), as appropriate and applicable, to understand the purpose and risks of the study, to provide informed consent, and to authorize the use of confidential health information in accordance with national and local privacy regulations.
- Genetically confirmed 5q-SMA.
- Age < 18 years at enrollment.
Key Exclusion Criteria:
- Unable or unwilling to provide informed consent.
- Other types of SMA (non 5q-SMA).
NOTE: Other protocol defined inclusion/ exclusion criteria may apply.

patient_data.ipd_description: In accordance with Biogen's Clinical Trial Transparency and Data Sharing Policy on http://clinicalresearch.biogen.com/
